The development of heterogeneous catalysts is very important for the chemical industry. [Ni0.5(en)] [Ni6(μ3-OH)3(en)3(H2O)6(B-α-SiW9O34)]·3.5H2O (Ni6en, en = ethylenediamine) is one of the representatives of those semi-open Ni6-cluster based polyoxometalates that could be easily synthesized and shows potential catalytic activity in heterogeneous catalytic system. In this work, Ni6en exhibited high stability and excellent catalytic activity in the condensation reaction of aldehydes and o-phenylenediamines at room temperature. A range of benzimidazole compounds could be isolated in good to excellent yields. Furthermore, this heterogeneous catalytic system could be scaled up to gram reaction, and Ni6en could be reused 5 times with no significant decrease in activity, showing its potential application prospect. Graphical abstract We synthesized a hexanuclear nickel-substituted silicotungstate with fully exposed Ni-oxo cluster, which exhibit high stability and excellent catalytic activity in the synthesis of benzimidazoles via the condensation cyclization of o-phenylenediamines and benzaldehydes. Image, graphical abstract Keywords Polyoxometalates Hexanuclear Nickel Heterogeneous catalyst Benzimidazoles Data availability Data will be made available on request. 1 Introduction Heterogeneous catalysts are widely used in chemical reactions due to the advantages of easy separation of catalyst from reaction mixture, reusability, good stability, and no environmental pollution [1–3]. In consequence, it is very important to discover new heterogeneous catalysts and/or develop known heterogeneous catalysts based on the requirement of green chemistry and chemical processes [4,5]. Polyoxometalates (POMs) are a famous class of catalysts with adjustable acidity and unique redox properties [6–11]. The certain and diverse structures of POMs enable the design and synthesis of catalysts with specific structures and performance at the molecular and atomic levels. [12–17]. Lacunary POMs with well-defined coordination sites and stronger nucleophilicity can coordinate with various metal cations to form heterogeneous metal-substituted POMs. Various transition-metal substituted POM with appealing structural features and diverse catalytic activities have been reported during the past decades [18–22]. Ni-substituted POMs has attracted much attentions due to their potential applications in catalysis, and many classic Ni-substituted POMs had been synthesized, such as [{Ni4(OH)3(A-α-SiW9O34)}4(OOC(CH2)3COO)6]32− [23], [H2{Ni5(OH)3(β-SiW8O31)(χ-SiW9O34)}2]24−, [Ni7(OH)6(SiW8O31)2]12− [24], [{Ni6(μ2-H2O)4(μ3-OH)2}(χ-SiW9O34)2]10− [25], [Ni6(μ3-OH)3(en)3(H2O)6(B-α-SiW9O34)]− [26], [Ni9(OH)6(CO3)3(A-α-SiW9O34)2]14− [27], [Ni12(OH)9WO4(W7O26(OH))(PW9O34)3]25− [28], [Ni14(OH)6(HPO4)4(P2W15O56)4]34− [29], [Ni25OH)18(CO3)2(PO4)6(SiW9O34)6]50− [30]. Among these above-mentioned POMs, lacunary POMs moieties (including multi-lacunary Keggin and Dawson POMs) bridge and stabilize Ni-oxo clusters to construct various Ni-substituted POMs with different configurations such as sandwich, trimer, or tetramer. It is noting that unlike the sandwich or multimer structure, one side of the Ni-oxo clusters in polyanion of Ni6en ( [Ni6(μ3-OH)3(en)3(H2O)6(B-α-SiW9O34)]−) is stabilized by a {B-α-SiW9O34} and the other side is fully exposed, which offers great opportunities for catalytic applications based on Ni-oxo clusters [31]. It is well known that nickel is a kind of metal element with diverse catalytic activities, such as hydrogenation reactions, redox reactions and cross-coupling reactions. In addition, nickel with unoccupied orbitals can accept electron pairs and thus exhibit Lewis acidity [32,33]. Ni6en has stable and fully exposed multinucleate Ni-oxo clusters, from which it can be inferred that Ni6en has good Lewis acid catalytic properties. However, no investigation has been reported about the Lewis acid catalytic properties of Ni6en yet. Benzimidazoles are a class of important N-heterocyclic skeletons with a variety of biological and pharmacological properties such as anti-depressant, anti-convulsant, anti-inflammatory, anti-allergic, and anti-pyretic [34,35]. Several commonly used drugs, such as Omeprazole, Maribavir, Bendamustine, Nocodazole, Albendazole, and Mebendazole, contain the benzimidazole skeleton [36–39]. In this sense, the exploration of novel catalytic system for the efficient construction of benzimidazoles is very important to the development of the pharmaceutical field and medicine [40–42]. Our group has been working on the development of green catalytic system based on POMs for the construction of heterocyclic compounds [43–47]. Based on the fully exposed reaction sites and ease of preparation of Ni6en, we used Ni6en as a catalyst to achieve the construction of benzimidazole compounds via the condensation cyclization of benzaldehydes and o-phenylenediamines. This catalyst exhibits high stability and excellent catalytic activity in this catalytic system. 2 Experimental 2.1 General information The reaction reagents were all commercially available and used directly without other treatment. FT-IR spectrum data were collected on the Thermo Nicolet iS5 FT-IR spectrophotometer. PXRD patterns were recorded on a Bruker D8 Advance diffractometer with Cu Kα radiation (λ = 1.5406 Å) at room temperature. The Bruker Ascend 500 (500 MHz for 1H) was used to record the 1H NMR spectra in DMSO‑d6. The Thermo Fisher/ISQ7000 was used to record the MS data. The Agilent 7890B gas chromatograph was used to record the GC data. 2.2 Synthesis of Ni6en The synthesis of Ni6en was based on the Ref. [26] 0.16 mmol Na10 [α-SiW9O34]·18H2O (0.4450 g), 2 mmol NiCl2 ·6H2O (0.4754 g), 0.2 mL en, 0.1 mL acetic acid and 16 mL H2O were in turn added into beaker and stirred for 0.5 h. The resulting reaction solution was then added into a Teflon-lined autoclave and placed in an oven at 170 °C to heat the reaction (Fig. 1 ). Green stick crystals of Ni6en were obtained after 3 days (55% yield based on Ni). IR (cm−1): 3582 (w), 3346 (w), 3252 (w), 2938 (w), 1591 (m), 1452 (m), 1381 (w), 1137 (m), 1038 (m), 934 (m), 863 (m), 770 (m), 694 (s), 532 (m). 2.3 Synthesis of benzimidazoles To a 4-mL reaction vial with a small magneton, 0.2 mmol benzaldehyde, 0.2 mmol o-phenylenediamine, 3 mol% Ni6en and 1 mL EtOH were added in turn. The vial was covered with a sealed cap, placed on a magnetic stirrer, and the reaction mixture was stirred for 1 h at room temperature. After the reaction, the volatiles were removed by a rotary evaporator. The resulting mixture was purified by flash column chromatography, affording the pure product as a white solid. After the reaction was completed, the catalyst was separated from the reaction solution by filtration, and then washed three times with EtOAc and EtOH, respectively, and finally the recovered catalyst was refreshed by drying in a vacuum drying oven at 50 °C for 3 h. 3 Results and discussion Ni6en was first reported by Yang's group. Ni6en is one of the representatives of those semi-open Ni6-cluster based POMs and is also the simplest semi-open structure in these kinds of Ni6-capped POMs. Single-crystal analysis demonstrated that six Ni(II) ions were captured by {SiW9O34}10− moiety to form a hexanuclear Ni6-cluster in a triangular configuration. Three μ3-OH connected six Ni(II) ions at the “exposed” side and each Ni(II) ion has one coordinated water molecule (Fig. 2 ). This phenomenon means that this kind of Ni6-cluster may possess unique molecular activation properties based on the easy separation of these coordinated water molecules. The condensation reaction of benzaldehyde 1a and o-phenylenediamine 2a to yield benzimidazole was chosen to test the performance of Ni6en. As shown in Table 1 , Ni6en showed good catalytic activity in the condensation reaction, affording the desired benzimidazole 3a in 71% yield (entries 1–2). We then tested the effect of a series of green solvents such as EtOH, propylene carbonate (PC), dimethyl carbonate (DMC), cyclopentyl methyl ether (CPME), H2O and i PrOH on the catalytic system and finally found that the reaction proceeded most smoothly in EtOH, affording 3a with the yield of 71% (entries 3–7). A higher yield (89%) was achieved by extending the reaction time to 1 h, which meant the reaction time was beneficial to the reaction at the stage of rising, while further prolonging the reaction time did not improve the yield (entries 8–9). The screening of catalyst loading indicated that 3 mol% was best for the dehydration condensation reaction (entries 10–11). The reaction can proceed efficiently at room temperature, and increasing the temperature did not improve the yield, further demonstrating the activity advantage of the catalyst (entries 12). After obtaining the optimal reaction conditions (Table 1, entry 8), the substrate scope of the cyclization reaction with benzaldehydes and o-phenylenediamines was investigated, and the results are summarized in Table 2 . A range of benzaldehydes containing electron-withdrawing and electron-donating groups react well with o-phenylenediamine, and the corresponding products were obtained with the yield of 75 %−91 % (3a-3i). The electron effect has a slight effect on the reaction yield, and in general, the electron-withdrawing groups can promote the reaction more than the electron-donating groups. Steric hindrance also affected the catalytic reaction, reflected in the reaction yield of 3h was lower than 3g and 3f. In addition, the applicability of the catalytic system to aliphatic aldehyde and heterocyclic aldehyde was also investigated. Fortunately, both n-hexanal and 5-methylfuran aldehyde were compatible with this catalytic system, affording the corresponding desired products with 78 % and 85 % yield, respectively (3j and 3k). The substrate scope of o-phenylenediamines was also studied, o-phenylenediamines containing chlorine, 5,6-dimethyl, and 5,6-dichlorine groups on the benzene ring were also compatible with the catalytic system, giving the corresponding products (3l, 3m and 3n) with 84 %, 85 % and 81 % yield, respectively. Finally, the practicability of the catalytic system was verified by the gram-scale reaction and catalyst cycling experiments. The condensation of 1a and 2a were used as model reaction for the gram scale reaction, and product 3a was obtained with a yield of 80 %, indicating the potential of this catalytic system for large-scale application (Fig. 3 a). To prove the stability of the catalyst, FT-IR and PXRD were used to test the catalyst before and after the reaction and the obtained spectra were consistent, indicating that Ni6en is very stable in the reaction and could be reused (Fig. 3b and c). The hot filtration experiments showed that when Ni6en is filtered out of the system, the reaction is almost no longer proceeds, and the yield remains unchanged, which indicates that the reaction is a heterogeneous catalytic system (Fig. 3d). The cycling experiments shows that Ni6en was reused five times with no significant reduction in catalytic activity, which further proves the stability of Ni6en (Fig. 3e). Furthermore, to demonstrate the advantages of this catalytic system for the synthesis of benzimidazoles, we summarized the reaction conditions and catalytic properties of some heterogeneous catalysts in the literature and compared them with the present work. Most of the catalysts given in Table S1 have problems such as higher catalyst dosage, toxic solvents, extra oxygen, longer reaction time, and higher reaction temperature. The comparison result with other reported catalysts highlights the advantages of this catalytic system, such as high activity, mild conditions, and environmental benignity. 4 Conclusions In summary, we developed a heterogeneous catalytic system based on a classic Ni6-cluster-based POM (Ni6en). Ni6en possesses a hexanuclear Ni-oxo cluster with one side stabilized by a {B-α-SiW9O34} polyanion. The fully exposed Ni-oxo cluster provides multiple highly active Lewis acid catalytic sites that exhibit good activity in the dehydration cyclization reaction of benzaldehydes and o-phenylenediamines. A range of benzimidazoles could be obtained with good yield under mild conditions, and the catalyst could be reused for several times without loss of activity. This study helps to guide the synthesis of heterogeneous POM catalysts with high catalytic properties and stabilities and may also provide a new horizon for the construction of benzimidazoles. coredata.dc:description: The development of heterogeneous catalysts is very important for the chemical industry. [Ni0.5(en)] [Ni6(μ3-OH)3(en)3(H2O)6(B-α-SiW9O34)]·3.5H2O (Ni6en, en = ethylenediamine) is one of the representatives of those semi-open Ni6-cluster based polyoxometalates that could be easily synthesized and shows potential catalytic activity in heterogeneous catalytic system. In this work, Ni6en exhibited high stability and excellent catalytic activity in the condensation reaction of aldehydes and o-phenylenediamines at room temperature. A range of benzimidazole compounds could be isolated in good to excellent yields. Furthermore, this heterogeneous catalytic system could be scaled up to gram reaction, and Ni6en could be reused 5 times with no significant decrease in activity, showing its potential application prospect.
coredata.dc:title: Hexanuclear nickel-substituted silicotungstate as heterogeneous catalyst for construction of benzimidazoles
